clinical_study.brief_title: Pegylated Liposomal Doxorubicin Combined With Anlotinib for Neoadjuvant Treatment of Soft Tissue Sarcoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective One-arm Study of Pegylated Liposomal Doxorubicin Combined With Anlotinib for Neoadjuvant Treatment of Locally Advanced Soft Tissue Sarcoma

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective one-arm study of pegylated liposomal doxorubicin combined with anlotinib for neoadjuvant treatment of locally advanced soft tissue sarcoma.

detailed_description.textblock: Tumor angiogenesis is very important in the occurrence and development of soft tissue sarcoma. The current clinical studies of molecularly targeted drugs are focused on the advanced treatment stage of soft tissue sarcoma. Anti-angiogenic drugs are not yet available in the neoadjuvant treatment stage of soft tissue sarcoma. Strong evidence. Therefore, this study aimed to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of pegylated doxorubicin liposomes combined with the anti-angiogenic drug Anlotinib for neoadjuvant treatment of patients with soft tissue sarcoma.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of Cycle 3 (each cycle is 21 days)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One year after the first intravenous drip

clinical_study.condition: Stage III Adult Soft Tissue Sarcoma

arm_group.description: Pegylated liposomal doxorubicin 50mg/m2 intravenous infusion on the first day + Anlotinib 12mg/d orally, medication on days 8-21, one cycle every 21 days, 2~4 cycles

intervention.description: Pegylated liposomal doxorubicin 50mg/m2 intravenous infusion on the first day + Anlotinib 12mg/d orally, medication on days 8-21, one cycle every 21 days, 2~4 cycles
